intro: Zeuxine elongata, commonly known as the slender false dragonhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. Zeuxine elongata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
